headline.main: A WORK OF DEATH IS SHOWN IN GABES; Destruction on the Beaches Is So Great It Seems as if Constructed PEOPLE FLY FRENCH FLAG They Say Italians Sought to Be Friendly, in a Common Hatred of Germans

lead_paragraph: WITH THE BRITISH EIGHTH ARMY AT GABES, March 31 (Delayed) -- Gabes is a ruined town. Most of the houses, both European and Arab, are without roofs or walls. None remained whole.
abstract: pub displays French flags on Allied forces entry
snippet: WITH THE BRITISH EIGHTH ARMY AT GABES, March 31 (Delayed) -- Gabes is a ruined town. Most of the houses, both European and Arab, are without roofs or walls. None remained whole....

byline.original: By A.C. SEDGWICKSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
